dropTarget.docsStayPrivate: Your documents stay private because they never leave your device.

about.terms: Using this website means that you agree with our {link}.
about.plugIn: PDF Snake 6 is a new online version of the best-selling Adobe Acrobat Plug-In {link}.
about.questions: We love to hear your questions and comments.
about.supportEmail: When reporting an issue, please copy and paste the below information into your email:

choose.trashTip: Drag and drop tools here to remove them from the toolbox.

help.introHtml: The paper size for the resulting document. To specify a paper size not listed in the box, select Custom in the Paper Size box, and then enter the page dimensions in the Width and Height boxes.
help.width: The width of the pages in the resulting document. Must be greater than zero.
help.height: The height of the pages in the resulting document. Must be greater than zero.
help.landscapeHtml: When checked, swaps the values for the width and height when creating pages in the resulting document. For example, if Letter is selected and Landscape is not checked then the resulting pages will be 8.5 by 11 inches. If Landscape is checked then the resulting pages will be 11 by 8.5 inches.

pageSize.ratioLocked: The aspect ratio is locked. Click to unlock.
pageSize.ratioUnlocked: The aspect ratio is unlocked. Click to lock.

pageOrder.doubleSidedHelp: Pages will be arranged so that page 2 appears on the back of page 1, etc.
pageOrder.repeatHelp: Each page in the source document will appear in the resulting document this many times.
pageOrder.sequentialHelp: Pages will be imposed in the same order they appear in the source document.
pageOrder.stackHelp: Pages will be arranged so that after being printed and cut, the resulting stacks can be stacked upon each other, and the resulting page order will match the source document.
pageOrder.trueStackHelpHtml:
There was a defect in PDF Snake versions 6.152 and older. With Page Order = stack and Repeat each page > 1, PDF Snake arranged the pages in the wrong order.

Clear the True stack checkbox to continue arranging pages in the same order as PDF Snake versions 6.152 and older.

Check the True stack checkbox and PDF Snake will reorder the pages correctly.

When Repeat each page = 1, the old page order and new page order are the same, the checkbox has no effect, so PDF Snake hides it.
pageOrder.stepAndRepeatHelp: Repeat each page so it fills one sheet.

autoscale.autoscaleHelp: When checked, pages are scaled to the largest size possible, while still fitting within the margins and gutters.

cropMarks.fourColorBlackHelp: When checked, crop marks are drawn with full cyan, magenta, yellow, and black ink. When not checked, the crop marks are drawn only in black ink.

help.intro: PDF Snake's Booklet tool re-arranges pages to make a booklet. It first shuffles them into book page order, and then puts two pages side by side on each sheet of paper. The resulting document can be folded and stapled down the middle to make a booklet or book.
help.step0: Books are bound using the following process:
help.step1: Sheets are printed 2 up, double sided.
help.step2: Sheets are put into stacks of N, usually around 5 sheets.
help.step3: Each stack is folded in half.
help.step4: The stacks are glued and/or stitched together.
help.step5: The free edges of the pages are cut to make all the pages flush.
help.saddleSizeHelp: The number of sheets to put into each stack and fold. When left empty, all the sheets are put into a single stack.
help.fillLastSaddleHtml: Often, there will be an odd number of pages in the source document, and the last fold will have some empty pages. When Fill last saddle is checked, blank pages will be added so that all folds will have the same number of sheets. When it is not checked, the last fold may have fewer sheets than the rest.
help.pageCreepHtml: In Step 5 of the book binding process listed above, the pages are cut to make the free edges flush. More paper is cut from the sheet in the center of the fold than from the sheet on the outside of the fold, because its edge sticks out more. This is called page creep. In order to compensate for this, and have all the pages appear in the same position after the book is bound and cut, the pages must be slightly adjusted, depending on factors such as paper thickness. Each page is slightly adjusted by the value set in Page Creep. To understand exactly what this does, try setting Page Creep to half an inch, or about ten millimeters, and look at the results.
help.rotatePages: Rotate output pages into portrait orientation, so it's easy to print from most office printers.
help.inward: The gutter width sets the gutter for booklet's outermost sheet, then pages creep inward towards the binding.
help.outward: The gutter width sets the gutter for the booklet's centerfold, then pages creep outward towards the edges.

rotate.degreesHelp: The angle to rotate the pages by.
rotate.help: PDF Snake's Rotate tool rotates pages by any degree.

help.intro: Page ranges are generally specified in the following format:
help.someExamples: However, the best way to understand how to specify page ranges is to look at some examples:
help.allThePages: all the pages in the document
help.pages-10-odd: all the odd numbered pages after page 10
help.pages-1-10-even-10-odd: pages 2, 4, 6, 8, 10 and all the odd numbered pages after page 10

shuffle.note: Note: Use the Insert Pages tool or {link} to merge pages from multiple documents.

help.intro: PDF Snake's Shuffle tool shuffles the pages in a document. All in one step it can reorder the pages, delete pages duplicate pages, add blank pages, and rotate pages.
help.format: Page orders are generally specified in the following format, very similar to the page range format.
help.allThePages: all the pages in the document, in the same order
help.theLastPage: the last page in the document
help.theSecondToLastPage: the second to last page in the document
help.pages-15-10: pages 10 through 15 in reverse order (6 pages)
help.allReversed: all the pages in the document in reverse order
help.pages-odd-even: all the odd pages followed by all the even pages
help.pages-odd-1-even: all the odd pages followed by all the even pages in reverse order
help.pages-5-1: five copies of the first page
help.pages-2-odd-even-8: all the odd pages, then all the even pages, then all the odd pages again, then all the even pages again, then page 8
help.pages-all-all: 2 copies of page 1, 2 copies of page 2, 2 copies of page 3, etc.
help.pages-square-odd-even: all the pages in normal order
help.rotateIntro: PDF Snake can rotate the pages as it shuffles them. Use the following symbols after the page number to specify the rotation:
help.allUpsideDown: all the pages in the document, upside down
help.pages-1-2-3-4: page 1, page 2 rotated 90 degrees clockwise, page 3 upside down, page 4 rotated 90 degrees counter-clockwise.
help.groupIntro: PDF Snake can repeat a shuffle pattern many times over the same document.  For example:
help.pages-group-3: for a six page document, yields the page order 3 2 1 6 5 4
help.blankIntro: PDF Snake will insert blank pages whenever you enter an X:

help.intro: PDF Snake's Calendar tool creates a calendar booklet from the imported PDF. It is formatted so that there is a picture and a calendar page on the same sheet of paper.
help.rotateBackCover: Rotates the back cover by 180 degrees to format it correctly for a calendar.
help.pageLayout: Choose the layout of the calendar to either fit each page by half sheets or full sheets.
help.halfSheet: Choose this option when your source document contains separate pages for the picture above the fold and the days of the month below the fold.
help.fullSheet: Choose this option when each page in your source document contains both the picture above the fold and the days of the month below the fold.

pages.thisDocumentTakesALongTime: This document takes a long time to display.
pages.clickOverlay: Click the button above to overlay page numbers.
pages.useTheTools: Use the tools to produce the layout you want.
pages.clickAgain: Click the button again to see your document.
pages.neverShowSlowRenderMessage: Never show me this message again.
pages.clickToPause: Click this button to pause automatic recalculation.

home.safariNoStickers: Safari has defects that prevent the Stickers tool from working correctly. Use the Monkey tool instead, or another browser.

error.duplicatePaperSizeName: '{name}' is already the name of a paper size
error.encrypted: {fileName} is encrypted.  I can't copy pages from encrypted documents.
error.powerOfTwo: must be a power of two. ex: 2, 4, 8, 16, etc.

help.intro: PDF Snake's Crop tool crops the edges of pages.
help.amount: The amount to crop each edge.

help.intro: PDF Snake's Resize tool shrinks or expands the pages' contents to fit any size paper.
help.preserveAspectRatio: When checked, preserves the ratio of height-to-width in the pages of the source document. If this box is not checked, the pages may be significantly stretched either horizontally or vertically.
help.stretch: Stretch the page to fit the new size. This may distort the image.

help.measurementsList: Margins, Crop Marks, Center Marks, Line Length, Line Thickness, Line Distance, Bleeds
help.measurementsIntro: The rest of the values in the dialog box are explained by this picture:

help.intro: PDF Snake's Grid tool imposes pages in a fixed pattern.  It also reorders pages so they come out double-sided, or can be cut and stacked.
PDF Snake's Monkey tool imposes pages in a variable pattern.  It finds the optimal pattern to fit as many source pages as possible on a single output page.
PDF Snake has all the tools you need to prepare your document for the printing press.
help.bookletHtml: Booklet reorders and imposes pages 2-up so the result can be printed, stacked, and folded in half.
help.monkeyHtml: Monkey finds the optimal pattern to fit the most pages onto a single sheet.
help.resizeHtml: Resize stretches and shrinks page contents to fit any paper size.
help.shuffleHtml: Shuffle rearranges the page order and rotates pages.
help.imposeCount: Users have imposed {count} documents with PDF Snake!
help.batchHtml: Select or drag and drop multiple documents at once to batch process.
help.cardsHtml: Cards is the easy way to create a sheet of identical business cards, post cards, stickers, etc.
help.nupBookHtml: N-up Book imposes pages to be folded, trimmed and bound into a book.
help.splitHtml: Split splits a large document into smaller documents.
help.overlayHtml: Overlay overlays the content of one PDF document onto another.
help.headerFooterHtml: Header or Footer adds page numbers, file names, or other text to the bottom or top of pages.
help.colorBarHtml: Color Bar adds color patches for monitoring and controlling the printing process.
help.nestHtml: Stickers imposes a sheet of stickers with overlapping white space.
help.calendarHtml: Calendar creates a calendar booklet from the imported PDF.
help.insertPagesHtml: Insert Pages inserts pages from another document into the currently open document.
help.export: Export your saved steps to share with others.
help.cutterMarksHtml: Cutter Marks draws indicators used to align cutting equipment precisely with the printed sheet.

help.intro: The Cards tool creates sheets of identical cards, stickers, etcs.  For more complex imposing layouts, see Grid.

flip.help: PDF Snake's flip tool flips pages on the horizontal access like a mirror. This is useful for preparing heat-transfer prints.

incognito.weRecommend: Concerned about your privacy?  So are we.  We recommend:
incognito.pleaseExit: Please exit your browser's incognito/private mode.
incognito.usingFirefox: Using {firefox}.  It protects your privacy even when not in incognito mode.

help.explanation: For example, a 25-page document named <tt>cats.pdf</tt> is split into 3 documents with a chunk size of 10 pages.

split.note: Note: {link} provides more ways to split documents.

help.repeat: When there are more pages in the bottom document than the top document, repeat pages from the top document.  For example, if there is only one page in the top document, it will be overlaid onto all the pages in the top document.
help.normal: Content in the top document replaces content in the bottom document. White blocks out content underneath.
help.multiply: Content in the top document is combined with content in the bottom document. White is transparent.
help.opacity: Opacity of the top content.  100% is fully opaque.  0% is invisible.
help.paddingHtml: Set Left and Top to control the location where the top document is overlaid.

help.move: The distance to move the contents.
help.intro: Nudge moves contents around pages.  It's the perfect tool for fixing registration issues with your scanner, press, or printer.

headerFooter.alternate: Alternate sides for odd and even pages.

help.intro: The Header or Footer tool adds page numbers, file names, or other text to the bottom or top of pages.

help.p1: In printing, a color bar, also known as a color control strip or color test strip, is a strip of color patches printed alongside the main image. It serves as a reference for monitoring and controlling the printing process. The color bar typically contains a range of color patches, including primary colors (cyan, magenta, yellow, and black), as well as secondary colors and grayscale tones.
help.p2: Printers use color bars to ensure accurate and consistent color reproduction throughout the printing job. By comparing the printed color patches to a standard reference, such as a color chart or target, printers can make adjustments to maintain color accuracy, adjust ink levels, and detect any issues with color registration.
help.p3: Color bars are essential tools in the printing industry, helping to achieve consistent and high-quality color output in various printing processes, including offset printing, digital printing, and other color reproduction methods.
help.margins: The distance between the color bar and the edge of the page is called the margin. The margin is typically 1/4 inch (6.35 mm) or less. The margin is measured from the edge of the color bar to the edge of the page.
help.size: The size of the color bar is the width of the color bar.  Each shape in the color bar is a square with this size.
help.spotColors: Spot colors are colors that are printed using premixed inks, rather than by combining primary colors (cyan, magenta, yellow, and black). Spot colors are used to print solid colors, such as logos, that are not easily reproduced using the primary colors. Check this box to print a color bar using spot colors.
help.shapes: The color bar consists of a variety of shapes to help you evaluate the quality of the printing process. Choose the shapes you want to include in the color bar.
help.repeat: Repeat the shapes in color bar across the page.  When not checked, each shape is printed only once.

safariBroken.title: Safari is Broken
safariBroken.defective: Your current browser, Safari, has defects that prevent PDF Snake from working correctly.
safariBroken.bestWithFirefox: PDF Snake works best with the Firefox browser.
safariBroken.wellWithChrome: PDF Snake also works well with {link}, but Firefox is faster.

help.p1: It packs as many stickers as possible onto a single sheet.
help.p2: When your stickers are rectangles, then the Stickers tool is no better than the Monkey tool.
help.p3: When your stickers are odd shapes with a transparent background, then the Stickers tool may pack more stickers onto a sheet than the Monkey tool.  Click {checkerboard} to see if your document has a transparent background.
help.p4: Of course, your printer paper need not have an adhesive backing. The Stickers tool is useful any time you intend to cut odd shapes from the paper.
help.padding: The minimum space between stickers on the resulting sheet.
help.margins: The minimum space between the stickers and the edge of the sheet.
help.nestingEffort: The higher the effort, the more time PDF Snake will spend trying to pack stickers onto the sheet.  The higher the effort, the more stickers may be packed onto the sheet.
help.rotations: More rotations for irregular shapes will probably yield a better fit, but it will take PDF Snake longer to find the best fit.

settings.appendFileNames: Append file names with tool names.
settings.appendCustomNames: Append file names with custom text.

insertPages.note: Note: {link} provides a drag-and-drop interface for mixing pages from different documents.

help.insertBefore: PDF Snake inserts pages before this page number in the open document.
help.repeat: The inserted pages can be repeated after every this many pages in the open document.

app.failedWebAssembly: Failed to load WebAssembly. PDF Snake requires a modern browser that supports WebAssembly.

help.summary: Cutter registration marks are printed indicators used to align cutting equipment precisely with the printed sheet during finishing operations. Unlike simple cutter marks, which indicate where to cut, cutter registration marks are read by sensors on automated cutting, slitting, or finishing machines to ensure each cut is accurately positioned relative to the printed content. These marks help compensate for slight shifts in sheet position, stretch, or skew during printing or feeding. They're essential in high-speed, automated workflows—especially in digital finishing systems—to maintain consistent output quality and prevent cutting errors.
help.margins: The distance between the cutter mark and the edge of the page is called the margin. The margin is typically 1/4 inch (6.35 mm) or less. The margin is measured from the edge of the cutter mark to the edge of the page.
help.shape: The shape of the marks to be drawn on the sheet.
help.size: The diameter of the circle or the length of one edge of the square.
help.layer: Marks will be drawn in this Optional Content Group.  Leave blank to draw the marks outside all content groups.
help.spacing: The distance between cutter registration marks drawn along the edges of the sheet.  PDF Snake always spaces the marks evenly, so the precise distance between the marks may be different from this value.
help.keyMark: An additional registration mark near one corner that the cutter uses to determine the orientation of the sheet.
help.dielines: Add dielines to your document to enable your digital cutter to automatically trim the artwork. Dielines appear on screen but are ignored by printers and presses. Make sure the dieline layer is named exactly as expected by your digital cutter.
